data.name: AcademicLicense
data.value: License for education, government, and non-profit

data.name: ActivateCitavi
data.value:
Here's how to enter your license key:

  1. Install Citavi Free if you haven't already: www.citavi.com/download
  2. Click here to copy your license key to the Clipboard.
  3. Start Citavi.
  4. On the Welcome Screen, click "License".
  5. Click "Enter a license key".
  6. Accept the license agreement, and then click "OK".

data.name: BuyHomeLicense
data.value: License for personal and student use

data.name: CannotAddEmailAddress
data.value:
To log in with this email address, you need a password.
You have not yet entered a password.

data.name: CitaviFree
data.value:
In order to try out Citavi for 30 days, you can get a free license for 30 days.

To edit projects with no limitations, you can
  • obtain a license, if your university or organization has a site license (usually the license will be free for you),
  • purchase a license in our online shop, or
  • redeem a gift certificate or voucher code.

Citavi Free users cannot use our email support services but can ask questions in the Citavi Forum.

data.name: LicenseDataHtml
data.value:
You have a license for {0}.

With this license, you can install Citavi on all personal devices and can save as many references as you want in each project.

To unlock the license, copy the license key to the Clipboard and start Citavi. On the Welcome Screen, click License > Enter a license key.

data.name: AccountDeleted
data.value:
Your Citavi account will now be deleted.
This may take a few minutes. You can close this tab.

data.name: DeleteAccountDescriptionHtml
data.value:
1. Your license and personal information will be deleted.
  2. Your cloud projects and all attached files (PDFs, etc.) will be deleted forever immediately. If you want to save information from Citavi Cloud, create local copies of your cloud projects before you delete your account. How can I do that?
  3. You will not be able to access cloud projects that others shared with you.
  4. If you shared cloud projects with others, they will no longer be able to access these projects.
  5. All locally created files, including your local projects, custom citation styles, and Word documents created with Citavi's Word Add-In will not be affected by the account deletion.
  6. After you log out of your local installation (Citavi 6 and later) or after 365 days at the latest, you will only be able to make changes to projects containing fewer than 100 references. Larger projects can be viewed but not modified.

data.name: MultipleCitaviAccounts
data.value: Have more than one Citavi account?

data.name: ThenYouCanDeleteAccount
data.value: Afterwards you can delete your Citavi account.

data.name: WantToDeleteCitaviAccount
data.value: Want to delete your Citavi account?

data.name: WhatHappens
data.value: What happens if you delete your Citavi account?

data.name: KeyAccountHtml
data.value:
Your central account ensures that you can carry out uninterrupted licensing procedures. For this reason, you can only edit your profile by contacting the Swiss Academic Software team.

You can make changes to the password and profile image. If you would like any other changes (for example, a change in your address) or if you would like to transfer the central account to a colleague, please write to us at account@citavi.com.
data.comment: Auch auf DE wäre "Key-Account" missverständlich, oder?

data.name: AdministratorAccountHtml
data.value: An administrator account is necessary for distributing Citavi licenses in an organization. For this reason, you cannot delete this account, but you can transfer the account to a colleague. If you would like to do this, please write us at account@citavi.com

data.name: RememberMeInfoHtml
data.value:
If Keep me logged in is enabled,the email address and password are encrypted and saved by the broswer in a cookie. This cookie is automatically deleted after 30 days. After that, you will need to log in again.
This only works if you do not log out of Citavi or delete your browser history.

If Keep me logged in is disabled,
you only need to close your broswer (not just the window), and you will be logged out.
This is especially important when working on a public computer.

data.name: ConfirmMembershipLowerHtml
data.value:
Alternative 1: Purchase a personal license at a discounted price
If you're no longer a member of the university or organization, you can purchase a non-expiring personal license at a 50% discount.

Alternative 2: Remove site license
If you're no longer a member of the university or organization and don't want to purchase a license, you can remove the site license from your account.

data.name: ConfirmProjectInvitationResult_Error
data.value: An error has occurred while accepting the invitation. Please contact the Citavi support team.

data.name: ConfirmProjectInvitationResult_OK
data.value:
You have successfully accepted the invitation to the Citavi project {0}.

Here's how you can access the project {0}:
  1. Start Citavi 6 for Windows.
  2. On the Welcome Screen, click the icon in the upper right to login with your email address.
  3. At the bottom of the Welcome Screnn, click Open project.
  4. You'll see the project {0} on the Cloud tab.

You can now close this page.

If you have not installed Citavi yet, you can download it here.

data.name: ConfirmProjectInvitationResult_ProjectInvitationNotFound
data.value:
Your project invitation could not be found.


Did you already accept the invitation?
If so, start Citavi. Click "Open project". The project will be listed on the "Cloud" tab.

Did you receive a new project invitation email?
If so, please accept the invitation in the new email.

Did you not yet receive a new invitation?
Please ask the project leader to send you a new invitation.

data.name: ConfirmProjectInvitationResult_UserIsNotVerified
data.value: You have successfully accepted access to the project, but your Citavi account is not yet verified. Please verify your account to access the project.

data.name: RecipientUnknownNotified
data.value:
The recipient was automatically notified by email. However, the recipient has not yet created a Citavi account.

You can send the email again.

Or you can enter another email address to assign the license to another user. The original recipient will then no longer receive a license.

data.name: UserHasNoAccountYet
data.value: The user has not yet created an account.

data.name: EmailConfirmedMobile
data.value: Your registration is complete. You can now log in to the Citavi Mobile App with your user name and password.

data.name: EmailConfirmedUsernamePassword
data.value: Your registration is complete. You can now log in to Citavi with your user name and password.

data.name: ToActivateCitavi
data.comment: {0} ist Citavi produktname zB "Citavi for Windows"

data.name: ExternalClientDesktop
data.value: Your registration is complete. You can now log in to Citavi with your user name and password.

data.name: ExternalClientMobile
data.value: Your registration is complete. You can now log in to the Citavi Mobile App with your user name and password.

data.name: ActivateCitavi6
data.value:
Here's how you can use the license in Citavi for Windows:
  1. If you haven't already done so, download and install Citavi Free: www.citavi.com/download
  2. Start Citavi and log in to your account.
  3. Citavi automatically pulls the license displayed here from our server. You do not need to perform any additional steps.

data.name: ActivateCitaviOldVersion
data.value: This is a license for a previous Citavi version. We recommend using Citavi 6 instead.

data.name: RevokeLicenseConfirm
data.value: The license {1} will be removed from {0}. Do you want to continue?
data.comment: {0} is the email or the name of the user whose license will be revoked, {1} the product name (eg Citavi 6 for Windows - Business)

data.name: RevokeLicenseDescription
data.value:
To assign the license to another person, please do the following:
  1. Remove the license from the current user. This panel will then automatically close.
  2. In the right-hand column click Assign license to.

data.name: EmailPresentMerge
data.value: An account with this email address is already present. You can merge it with the current account.

data.name: RecoverDeletedProject_Error
data.value: You have either entered a wrong URL, or the corresponding project has been deleted more than ten days ago. After that period, all project data is permanently deleted and the project cannot be recovered any more.

data.name: AlreadyHaveCitaviAccount
data.value: I already have a Citavi account:

data.value: Your registration is complete. You can now log in to Citavi with your university login under "My university".

data.name: ExternalClientMobileShibboleth
data.value: Your registration is complete. You can now log in to the Citavi Mobile App with your university login under "My university".

data.value: Enter the correct email address here:

data.value:
We're redirecting you to your university's login page.

This can take a few seconds. Log in there with the username and password for your university account.

data.name: BetaLoginInfo
data.value:
In this beta version authentication via external providers is not possible.

Please log in with your email address and password.

data.name: AutomaticRestartAfterMerge
data.value: Citavi Account will automatically restart after the merging process is complete.

data.name: LoadFailedProject
data.value: The project can't be loaded right now. Please try again later.

data.name: Subscription_CurrentValidityEndOn
data.value: End of current validity period on

data.name: Subscription_Description
data.value: Licenses and other products with the same renewal date are bundled together in a subscription. You'll only receive one bill for the renewal of all items in the subscription.

data.name: Subscription_LicenseSubscriptionEnded
data.value: The subscription containing this license has been cancelled. The license will remain active until the end of the current validity period.

data.name: Subscription_ConfirmEndSubscription
data.value: The licenses in this subscription will remain active until the end of the current validity period. After that the subscription containing the licenses will not be renewed.

data.name: Subscription_SubscriptionEnded
data.value: The subscription has been cancelled. The licenses will remain active until the end of the current validity period.

data.name: Subscription_RemoveLicensesDescriptionHtml
data.value:
Please do the following:

  1. Close this panel. You will see a list of the licenses in the selected subscription.
  2. In the middle column, select the license you want to remove from the subscription.
  3. In the lower right, click "{0}".

The licenses will remain active until the end of the current validity period. When the subscription is renewed, these licenses will not be included.

data.name: License_Activate
data.value: Include license in the next subscription renewal.

data.name: License_Deactivated
data.value: This license has been excluded from the next renewal. It will only remain active until the end of the current validity period.

data.name: License_Deactivate_Description
data.value: The excluded license will remain active until the end of the current validity period. When the subscription is renewed, this license will not be included.

data.name: License_CloudspaceActivate
data.value: Include storage space in the next subscription renewal.

data.name: License_CloudspaceDeactivate
data.value: Exclude this storage space from renewal

data.name: License_CloudspaceDeactivated
data.value: This storage space has been excluded from the next renewal. It will only remain active until the end of the current validity period.

data.name: License_ExcludeCloudspaceFromRenewal
data.value: Exclude this storage space from renewal

data.name: AssignCloudSpace
data.value: Assign storage space to a user

data.name: License_ChangeUserNotAllowed_Description
data.value: To change the user for the storage space, the current user needs to allow access to his storage space. The user will need to delete projects until only 1 GB of free storage is in use.

data.name: LoginNotAllowed
data.value: The login with this Citavi Account is not allowed at the moment. If you are the owner of this account, please contact the Citavi-Support: https://www.citavi.com/service.

data.name: InvalidEmailDomainAndEmailAlreadyPresent
data.value: Invalid email domain. This address already belongs to this account.

data.name: Licenses_ChooseFilter
data.value: Make a selection in the left column to display licenses.

data.name: ChangePasswordWarning
data.value:
Warning: When you change your password, you'll be logged out of all active sessions.
Close all instances of Citavi (including Citavi for Windows) before you continue.

data.name: ResetPasswordWarning
data.value:
Warning: After you enter your new password, you'll be logged out of all active sessions.
Close all instances of Citavi (including Citavi for Windows) before you continue.

data.name: AccountIsKeyContact
data.value: The email address you entered is a key contact email address. Please write to account@citavi.com if you want to merge your accounts or the account of a colleague.

data.name: ConfirmProjectInvitationResult_OK_CWeb
data.value:
You have successfully accepted the invitation to the Citavi project {0}.

Here's how you can access the project {0}:
  1. Start Citavi 6 for Windows.
  2. On the Welcome Screen, click the icon in the upper right to login with your email address.
  3. At the bottom of the Welcome Screen, click Open project.
  4. You'll see the project {0} on the Cloud tab.

If you have not installed Citavi yet, you can download it here.

NEW: On November 30, 2020 the beta test for Citavi Web started. You can now also work with your cloud projects in your browser.
  1. Click here to read important information about Citavi Web Beta.
  2. Log in to Citavi Web Beta here. Your cloud project will open automatically.

You can now close this page.

data.name: ConfirmProjectInvitationResult_OK_CWeb_Prod
data.value:
You have successfully accepted the invitation to the Citavi project {0}.

Here's how you can access the project {0} with Citavi 6:
  1. Start Citavi 6 for Windows.
  2. On the Welcome Screen, click the icon in the upper right to login with your email address.
  3. At the bottom of the Welcome Screen, click Open project.
  4. You'll see the project {0} on the Cloud tab.

If you have not installed Citavi yet, you can download it here.

Alternatively you can now also work with your cloud projects in your browser using Citavi Web.
  1. Click here to learn more about Citavi Web.
  2. Log in to Citavi Web Beta here. Your cloud project will open automatically.

You can now close this page.

data.name: PasswordEqualsUsername
data.value: Your password cannot be the same as your username

data.name: DesktopLoginSuccess
data.value:
1. On the login screen in Citavi for Windows, select a login optiona and then click "Log in".
  2. As soon as you're logged in, you can close this tab.
